item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S7120-7121; text: CR S7119-7120)

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S7120-7121; text: CR S7119-7120)

bill.title: A resolution designating November 9, 2017, as "National Diabetes Heart Health Awareness Day", coinciding with American Diabetes Month.

item.name: Introduced in Senate
item.text: Expresses support for: (1) the designation of November 9, 2017, as National Diabetes Heart Health Awareness Day; and (2) the efforts of the Department of Health and Human Services and the medical community to educate people about the risks, symptoms, and treatment of diabetes to include comorbid cardiovascular diseases and risk factors.

item.name: Passed Senate without amendment
item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Expresses support for: (1) the designation of November 9, 2017, as National Diabetes Heart Health Awareness Day; and (2) the efforts of the Department of Health and Human Services and the medical community to educate people about the risks, symptoms, and treatment of diabetes to include comorbid cardiovascular diseases and risk factors.

item.latestTitle: Expressing support for the designation of November 9, 2017, as "National Diabetes Heart Health Awareness Day", coinciding with American Diabetes Month.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

item.title: A resolution designating November 9, 2017, as "National Diabetes Heart Health Awareness Day", coinciding with American Diabetes Month.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
